discovery_questions.tell_me_about_yourself: i sleep 5 hours of not great sleep
discovery_questions.sleep_habits: i like to play video games

goals.goal: it would mean waking up feeling more refreshed i think turn off screens at 11 and be in bed by 11:30 . i think 3 days is realistic for me two weeks seems good
Walking around my neighborhood sounds good 30 min sounds doable 2x a week im thinking friday and saturday

metadata.what_happened: i want to adjust my sleep goal actually

chat_history.content: [START_SESSION]

Hi Jade, welcome to our final session together! It's great to see you here. 

Before we dive in, I'd love to hear how the past week went for you. How did things go with your sleep routine goal of turning off screens at 11 and being in bed by 11:30, and your walking goal of 30 minutes twice a week on Fridays and Saturdays?
it went great

That's wonderful to hear! I'm so glad it went well for you. 

Can you tell me a bit more about what made it go great? What specifically worked well for you this week?
i had more time so i was able to focus on my goals

That's fantastic that having more time allowed you to really focus on taking care of yourself. It sounds like you made the most of that opportunity.

So just to make sure I'm understanding correctly, were you able to complete both goals - the sleep routine of screens off at 11 and in bed by 11:30 for three days, and the 30-minute walks on Friday and Saturday?
yup

That's amazing, Jade! You set out to achieve both of your goals and you did it. That takes real commitment, especially with everything else you have going on.

What happened that made it easier for you to stick with these goals this week?
i had more time
Got it, having more time definitely helped. I'm curious though, when you actually did these things - the evening routine and the walks - what did you notice? How did they make you feel?
i noticed i felt better throughtout the day and the enxt day

That's a really important connection you're making - that taking care of yourself in the evening and getting some movement actually helped you feel better the next day and throughout the day. That's your body telling you what it needs.

Now I want to check in on something. On a scale of 1 to 10, what was your stress level like this past week?

That's wonderful to hear your stress is so low right now. It sounds like things are in a really good place for you.

Since you had success with your goals and you're feeling less stressed, what would you like to focus on for the next week - would you like to continue building on what's working, or is there something new you'd like to work on?
i want to adjust my sleep goal actually

Absolutely, we can adjust your sleep goal. Before we do that though, I want to make sure I understand what happened with your current goals this week.

You mentioned wanting to adjust the sleep goal - does that mean you were able to do the screens off at 11 and in bed by 11:30 for three days, or did something come up that made you realize you need a different approach?
yeah i was able to complete the goal but i actually wanted to go up to 4 days

That's excellent that you completed your goal and now you're ready to challenge yourself a bit more. Adding one more day to make it 4 days a week sounds like a great progression.

On a scale of 1 to 10, how confident are you about achieving this adjusted goal of screens off at 11 and in bed by 11:30 for four days a week?

That's great confidence! Let's talk about how you'll remember to work on these goals after our program ends.

Since this is our final session together, what kind of system do you think will help you stay on track with your sleep goal - maybe a phone reminder, a journal to track your progress, or something else that fits your style?
i have my reminders
Perfect, your reminders will keep you on track. How will you keep these goals going after our program ends?
i have my reminders of course and i was planning on downloading a motivational app

That sounds like a solid plan with your reminders and the motivational app to keep you going.

Do you have any final questions or anything else you'd like to discuss before we wrap up?
no

It's been wonderful working with you, Jade. You've shown real commitment by adjusting your goals to fit your life and building a system to keep yourself accountable. I'm confident you'll continue making progress with your sleep and walking goals. Best of luck with everything, and take care!
bye
Goodbye, Jade. Best wishes on your health journey!
